name: Holiday Inn Express Petersburg-Fort Lee

reviews.text: Frequently, on trips to SC, I stop overnight in Petersburg. This was my first stay at this Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Overall, a good place to stay

likes.disliked: — Smell of smoke in non-smoking room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was easy and the associate was very friendly. She gave us some snacks and cold water which was appreciated. The room was spacious and clean with very comfortable pillows on the beds. Fox News, the History Channel, A&E, and Discovery Channel were part of the cable lineup which was fantastic.
reviews.title: Ideal for an overnight stay

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice and a great value for the money. We got a special internet rate, purchase three days in advance and save 20%. As others have said when we got there we asked for a complimentary upgrade to a suite and we got it and we had two rooms. The suite was large and roomy with a seperate bedroom. There were two televisions (ask for a second remote if you need it, room comes with one). There was a sofabed in the living room and a bunch of cabinets a microwave and fridge, no dishes of course. The breakfast over the weekend was cornedbeef hash, fake eggs and a variety of breads, biscuits and gravy, no waffles. On Monday there was sausage and bacon, it was overall very good. My favorite part was the pool even tho it was closed all weekend for roof repair on one end, we were able to still use it. The water was WARM, really superb. The jaccuzi was really hot and full of chlorine bewarned it will fade dark suits and tees etc. It was nice tho we didn't mind. All in all no complaints we always stay at HIE and this one didn't disappoint. The morning manager is really pleasant and can give better rates, the afternoon into the night manager speaks Chinese and is difficult to understand and be understood. Also the desk and chair was large and roomy and very comfortable to work on./ We also ate at the restaurant accross the street near the Days Inn and the food was great.(The Lighthouse) The prices went up since another user reviewed it the average meal is $16. food only. The hush puppies were great also the fried oysters and jumbo shrimp were our favorite( create your own). There is a karyoke room there and you hear the music, not bad just smokey if you want to go to the bathroom as you have to walk thru the karyoke/bar to the restroom. The waitress was not the friendliest.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel, ripoff joint, does not and will not honor customer requests for changes in their reservations. I requested to change my reservation due to my wife's illness, and I was told that there was nothing they could do!!! Even though they took my money!!! Tell your friends and family to be careful when dealing with this organization!!! The parent company is no better, they wouldn't help either!!!
reviews.title: Lousy customer service!!!

reviews.text: Got a good deal on this hotel and it served it's purpose. We were checked in quickly and the room (suite) was quite large and accommodated our family of 6. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was sufficient. Our only issue was a musty smell when we walked in, however this was cleared out after running the AC. The breakfast the following morning was quite nice and had options for all my picky eaters.
reviews.title: nice stop on our way to Outer Banks

reviews.text: My family statyed at this Holiday Inn both to and from Myrtle Beach this past week. Both times we had an excellent stay. We used the indoor pool after a long drive and enjoyed a quick breakfast in the morning before the second half of our tip. The rooms were immaculate and the beds soft. Will definately return.
reviews.title: Good Half Way Point on Vacation

reviews.text: We stopped here for one night. We arrived our room was ready. This hotel was quite easy to find right off the I-95. I believe this is one of the better hotels in the area. The staff was very nice at check in. Our room was very clean. After a long drive I took my children to the pool/spa area. The pool was excellent. The spa was excellent. The water would have been 100 degrees at least and the area itself was clean. The best part of the day. I highly recommend this hotel , for anyone traveling. If you are looking for a good spot to eat , right across the street is a restaurant called The Lighthouse. Very good food with good portions and great price. Very homey and excellent staff.
reviews.title: Nice Holiday Inn

reviews.text: We recently had to travel to Petersburg for my husband's schooling. I was nervous to find a nice place to stay as I had heard that Petersburg wasn't such a great town... I was very happy to book a room at the HI Express after reading the good reviews online. The hotel appears to be pretty new and everything is very clean and modern. When we arrived we discovered that we had been upgraded to a suite (whoohoo!). The room was clean and spacious (and a great deal!). There was a jacuzzi tub in the room, which was great, but only a few of the jets in the tub actually worked. However, since we had not reserved this particulary room, nor paid extra for it, we did not mind the lack of working jets. The hotel is located right off of the interstate and is a short drive to restaurants and other shopping. The free breakfast was pretty good and had a variety of food. We really enjoyed our stay here and if we return to the area, we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

likes.liked: — Clean, large room; Free breakfast; Modern Decor; Jacuzzi Tub

reviews.text: Staff was professional and efficient. Rooms are large and come with mini fridge and mini microwave. Pool was very nice and so was whirlpool. Nice business center. Rooms were very clean and smelled great. Clean beds and bathroom. Bedding was surprisingly nice for a Holiday Inn Express. Great bedsheets and comforter. One of the best Holiday Inn Express hotels that I have ever stayed in. Management keeps the property in good condition. Hope they can maintain the condition of the hotel for years to come. Good value for the stay.
reviews.title: Outstanding Stay. Very Clean and Comfortable. Best Holiday Inn Express.

likes.liked: — Very clean and fresh smelling rooms. Excellent breakfast attendant. Her name was Sarah.
likes.disliked: — Poorly stocked pool area. No towels and the water was cold that night.

reviews.text: Very nice hotel! We booked a suite and it was bigger than most we've stayed in. Breakfast buffet was great. Location next to highway so hard to fall asleep at first....noise
reviews.title: Nice property

reviews.text: This inn meets the standards I have come to expect from the Holiday Inn Express -- a clean, comfortable, stylish room and public areas, efficient and polite check in, excellent bed and bedding, lots of good variety for breakfast, etc. Though I believe this is a new hotel, it is already beginning to show some wear and tear -- there were rips in the curtains in our room (but sort of hard to see at first given the fabric pattern, which may explain why no repairs had been done) and the bathroom tile grout is cracking. But believe me, this outstanding a property on I 95 is a FIND!! We will stay again on our next trip south.
reviews.title: Nice stay at a good Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: I was totally shocked by the EXCELLENT decor of the room. I had a king room suite. Bedding was outstanding. Room was very clean and neat. The suite layout was outstanding. I've seen other Holiday Inn Express and this is HEAD and SHOULDERS above the rest.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently spent a night at the Holiday Inn Express in Petersburg/Ft. Lee, VA. This place was wonderful -- the room we were given exceeded our expectations -- jacuzzi and all -- great bedding. We reserved a standard room and got upgraded to a suite. Complimentary breakfast was great also. Easy access off I-95. I can't say enough about this place. We were on our way to Myrtle Beach and will stop there again. Staff was excellent also.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.text: We went to this hotel after leaving the Sleep Inn Roanoke Rapids, NC. We did not have a reservation and did not mind paying extra money. The hotel was really modern, nice and clean. If you are driving back north from Myrtle Beach this is a nice place to stop.
reviews.title: Worth the extra drive

likes.liked: — The welcoming lobby and the room was very nice. The bed linnens were great.

reviews.text: This is a great new place with a very attractive modern decor. The pool was not large, but not small and had a small hot tub. The room was spacious and CLEAN. The breakfast was tasty and the server kept the buffett well stocked. There was a hot option and make your own waffles. This place seems stuck with a bunch of other hotels off the interstate ramp. However if you drive just a mile or so up the highway you will come to a mall with fast food and chain dining establishments. As we didn't arrive until 9 pm we ate at the most hip Arby's I've ever seen. (Bet you never expected to see those 2 words together but if you go there you'll see what I mean.) Petersburg itself is a few miles up the road. We read about the crater from the civil war and it wasn't much to see. Overall, this is a great stop along the highway and I would definately recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice, new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don’t know why people come to this area, but if you’re here this is the place to stay.
reviews.title: Great for Petersburg area

reviews.text: Conveniently located off the interstate and adjacent to Hampton Inn , Days Inn, Travelodge, and Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Petersburg-Fort Lee Hotel
description: Stay where contemporary hospitality meets thoughtful amenities, at the Holiday Inn Richmond Petersburg North Ft Lee. Located just off I-95 at exit 53 in Colonial Heights, we offer a convenient gateway to Petersburg, Hopewell, Prince George, Dinwiddie, Chester, as well as Fort Lee and Virginia State University. Surround yourself with a diverse range of attractions, from the thrills of Virginia Motorsports Park to the Petersburg National Battlefield and Pamplin Historical Park to the bargains at Southpark Mall. Even if you're in Petersburg/Colonial Heights to enjoy the great outdoors, we want you to enjoy our great indoors as well. Savor tasty grill favorites and delightful ambiance in the Mixing Bowl Restaurant, or dine in the privacy of your room. Enjoy the solitude of elegant rooms, featuring stylish dÃ©cor and the comforts of home. Stay current and connected with high-speed Internet access. Stock your refrigerator with snacks, drinks, and easy-to-prepare meals. Polish up tomorrow's presentation at your spacious work desk with ergonomic chair. Hosting an event? Select from over 6,000 square feet of event space, including 5 elegantly appointed meeting rooms. Trust our on-site event planners to design a flawless catered event. We're here, ready with all you need to make your trip to the Tri-Cities a success. We're the new Holiday Inn Richmond Petersburg North Ft Lee!
